description.narrative: By 2021, Children and families in the areas covered by the programme, especially girls, women and vulnerable people, are informed and educated about hygiene.

sector.narrative: Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management

title.narrative: Central African Republic United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Central African Republic Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (WASH)
UNICEF Programmes in Central African Republic
Central African Republic Country Programme Document 2018-2021
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Central African Republic: Summative evaluation of the CLTS project in CAR
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, Children and families in the areas covered by the programme, especially girls, women and vulnerable people, are informed and educated about hygiene.

description.narrative: In terms of hygiene promotion, 100,112 additional people were sensitized to handwashing with soap, menstrual hygien and good hygiene practices at the community level, as well as 47,596 pupils in the schools through public awareness campaigns, during home visits and focus group. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/11/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of school children (boys and girls) washing hands after using toilet
Number of people receiving messages on sanitation and hygiene
Number of school teachers trained on water related disease prevention and hygiene
Number of school girls received education on menstrual hygiene management.
Number school children (boys, girls) trained on hygiene good practices
Number of health care providers trained on hygiene good practices
